  • Automate across hybrid cloud environments

    A comprehensive workload automation (WLA) and job scheduling platform, ActiveBatch enables IT teams to automate and coordinate cross-platform processes or job chains.

    efficient IT and business process automation via seamless integration across your entire environment — multi-cloud, hybrid cloud or on-premises.

  • Orchestrate from a single pane of glass

    Bring together job scheduling and monitoring and reduce IT complexity with a central automation hub for business-critical systems and applications.

    Connect ERP, ETL, supply chain management, work order management, project management and more.

  • Break free from the limits of time

    Build smooth end-to-end automated processes and increase job success rates with ActiveBatch's robust event-driven architecture and advanced date/time scheduling.

    • Trigger jobs based on various external conditions with flexible scheduling options
    • Use a universal job type for end-to-end orchestration on any server, service or application
    • Apply intelligent load balancing to reduce slack time and bottlenecks
    • Perform and manage enterprise file transfers via FTP, SFTP (SSH) or FTPS (TLS)
    • Execute database procedures and integrate with ETL and data warehousing applications
    • Stay up and running with automatic failover to standby schedulers in the event of a production environment failure

  • Let your IT team focus on innovation

    Automate in half the time with ActiveBatch’s Job Steps Library. Choose from hundreds of production-ready job steps: out-of-the-box building blocks for commonly scripted actions and functions.

    Drop them into your IT and business workflows in an intuitive GUI.

Workload automation FAQs

Is AutoSys outdated?

AutoSys is still widely used, but many IT teams consider it outdated compared to modern workload automation tools. Originally built for on-premises environments, it requires significant manual scripting and has limited support for hybrid cloud, real-time orchestration and self-service capabilities. As enterprise needs shift toward scalable, API-driven platforms that support containerized workloads and dynamic provisioning, AutoSys may not meet current demands without extensive customization.

Broadcom’s development pace and support model have also led organizations to explore AutoSys alternatives with broader cross-platform support, improved user interfaces and lower operational overhead. Many of these tools offer native integrations for AWS, Azure, SAP and VMware, along with low-code options for building and managing jobs. These key features help you streamline complex workflows, align with DevOps practices and support automation use cases across diverse IT environments.

Find the Best Enterprise Job Scheduling Software
What is the difference between AutoSys and ActiveBatch?

AutoSys is a job scheduling tool from Broadcom that primarily supports on-premises environments with batch processing and scripting. Its architecture often relies on manual configurations and lacks out-of-the-box integrations for modern platforms like AWS, Azure and SaaS tools. AutoSys requires more effort to scale across hybrid cloud environments and doesn’t provide low-code options for job creation, making it more complex to adapt to dynamic IT operations or DevOps pipelines.

ActiveBatch by Redwood, on the other hand, is a workload automation platform with broader cross-platform compatibility and support for drag-and-drop workflow design. It includes built-in connectors for ERP systems, file transfers and ETL tools across multi-cloud and on-premises environments. ActiveBatch emphasizes self-service, real-time orchestration and end-to-end process automation with dashboards and APIs that simplify provisioning, SLA management and job execution across diverse operating systems like Linux, Microsoft and Unix.

Discover the 6 Factors to Consider for Workload Automation Security
What is workload automation software?

Workload automation software is used to schedule, trigger and manage a wide range of IT tasks across systems, applications and environments. It replaces manual scripting with centralized control over job scheduling, workflows and dependencies, helping teams coordinate complex processes across cloud, on-premises and hybrid infrastructures. These tools often include support for file transfers, batch processes, real-time job status alerts and SLA tracking.

Modern platforms offer low-code or no-code user interfaces, making it easier to connect business applications, data pipelines and ERP systems without deep scripting knowledge. With built-in integrations for tools like SAP, Oracle and VMware, workload automation solutions help optimize process automation, reduce delays and support orchestration across cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure. They’re designed to support scalability, cross-platform functionality and API-based automation for evolving IT environments.
